The entire time estimated for this program is ~1 hour:

Initial sign-up, doing the Wellbeing & Engagement (PERMAH) assessment, and setting your priorities: 15-20 minutes
July 3 reflection and review call: 45 minutes
Follow-on discussions in Geneva/etc, and the time you spend on your wellbeing activities, all optional and up to you! üôÇ
 

The program primarily focuses on Wellbeing & Engagement using the PERMAH framework, but there are some other guided reflection assessments that you can also do in this program (info below), and we can easily add in other assessments for other programs as well.

Thanks! üåªüòä

David Munir Nabti and the Bloom team

 

~~

Program Steps

See a video walkthrough of these 4 quick steps here.

 

1Ô∏è‚É£ Step 1: Click here to join the TWP+Bloom for Wellbeing Program on Bloom, which simultaneously helps you create an account and team on Bloom.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Step 2: Do the Wellbeing & Engagement (PERMAH) Assessment. You should be automatically taken there when you click the link above to create your account, but if not, then you can click here to go there directly (after you create your account), or find it your Growth Page for the team that‚Äôs in the TWP+Bloom program.

You can add other people to your team if you want, just keep in mind that they and your program managers will see your assessment results and priorities. (You can create a separate private team if you want to work on things that you don‚Äôt want to share with others on your team or the program managers.)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Step 3: Check your results, and set your Wellbeing & Engagement Priorities. 

4Ô∏è‚É£ Step 4: Click here to let us know if you can join the 45-minute review check-in call on July 3 (7pm Lebanon, 4pm GMT, noon North America East Coast EST). It‚Äôs optional but encouraged. After you register there we‚Äôll add that to your calendar as well.

 

That‚Äôs it! üôÇ 

 

The check-in call will be fun, will help guide you towards progress in your priority areas for growth, plus we‚Äôll show you what it looks like for Program Managers, and how Bloom helps program managers and teachers run programs that adapt to the needs of each cohort, team and individual.

 

~~

Additional Optional Steps:

Step 5 (optional): Identify growth activities in your priority areas from Bloom‚Äôs Library of Activities, or create your own, and add them to your taskboard to help you track your progress and share with your program.

We have more assessments on the platform, but the only ones we enabled for this program are the Wellbeing & Engagement (PERMAH) one shared above, Universal Skills, and the Inner Development Goals. (Note, we haven‚Äôt linked the activities to the IDG priority areas yet.)

‚Äì DMN and The Bloom Team üåª

Overall, the landing page is informative and friendly, but there are areas where you can improve clarity and engagement, which could help increase participation. Here are my specific suggestions:

1. **Headline**: Use a compelling and concise headline. "Join our TWP+Bloom Wellbeing Short Demo Program!" could be more attractive.

2. **Program Details**: Explain the program's objective upfront. What can participants expect to gain? It could be something like, "Discover new tools to enhance your Wellbeing and Engagement in just two weeks!"

3. **Time Commitment**: The estimated time commitment section should be more concise and clear, with bulleted points to make it easy to understand.

4. **Feedback Channels**: Make sure you let them know that their feedback is not only appreciated but also crucial for the growth of the community. "We value your thoughts! Please don't hesitate to share your feedback either via the form at the bottom of this page or by emailing me at dmn@bloom.pm."

5. **Program Steps**: Visuals can be more engaging. Consider using graphics or icons for each step to make them more visually appealing and easier to understand.

6. **Step 2**: Reassure the users about their privacy when they add people to their team. You could rephrase it as: "Feel free to add team members to join you on this journey. Rest assured, you control what you share with your team."

7. **Optional Steps**: Clearly distinguish between the essential steps and optional steps, perhaps with separate sections or different colors. This makes it easier for the user to understand the main path versus the optional extras.

8. **Final Call to Action (CTA)**: End with an encouraging and strong CTA, such as "Let's bloom together! Join now." 

9. **Overall Tone and Language**: The language can be a bit formal at times. Consider using more casual, inviting language that makes users feel part of a community, rather than participants in a program. 

Here's how the landing page could look after the revisions:

---

- **Sign-up and initial assessment**: 15-20 minutes
- **Reflection and review call on July 3**: 45 minutes
- **Optional follow-on discussions and wellbeing activities**: at your discretion

We'll explore the PERMAH framework for wellbeing, alongside other helpful assessments. We welcome feedback at any stage; your thoughts are valuable to us! Share your feedback through our form or email me directly at dmn@bloom.pm.

Thank you!

David Munir Nabti and the Bloom team
